page.title: 16LANDSCAPE
page.content: The River Test meanders in a labyrinth of waterways - many man-made - in the E of this block, while to the W the downs rise sharply, in some places showing the underlying chalk, quarried mainly for land-fill; there is a good proportion of deciduous trees; the chalk turns to clay further E where it is used for brick-making at Michelmersh. There are approx. 18.25 km of public footpaths, none of which now have any practical uses for communication, but their recreational value should not be underestimated. Responsibility for maintenance lies with the Hampshire County Council; most landowners are sympathetic to the preservation of footpaths. Constant pressure by interested bodies is necessary to ensure the continued existence of the footpath network.
